intro: Bromopsis pumpelliana subsp. taimyrensis, commonly known as the Taimyren sedge, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and compact growth habit. This subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in cloud forests or alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
